Pre-Game Insights: Croatia are in need of a win to stand any chance of continuing their campaign at Euro 2024.
Croatia meet Group B rivals Italy in Leipzig on Monday evening.
Head coach Zlatko Dalic is sure to rotate his resources in search of a quick change in fortunes.
Marcelo Brozovic may now be dropped to the bench, allowing an opportunity for Luka Sucic or Martin Baturina to start instead.
Bruno Petkovic missed a penalty against Spain and then made way for Ante Budimir midway through the second half against Albania, so the latter could be promoted to the starting XI.
Josko Gvardiol is set to continue in his preferred role; ever versatile, Ivan Perisic filled in at full-back, but Borna Sosa may now win the fight for selection.
Others: The match will take place at the Red Bull Arena on June 24, 2024, at 8pm UK.
Croatia's possible starting lineup is: Livakovic; Stanisic, Sutalo, Gvardiol, Sosa; Modric, Sucic, Kovacic; Pasalic, Budimir, Kramaric.
